page.title: 16Farming _ Pinnells End Farm
page.content: The site of Mr. Cook's farm goes back many centuries. Parts of the house date back 300 years. Mr. Cook has lived here for ten years. Today it is a busy dairy farm of 180 acres. There are 14 fields, of which 3 are hay, 3 are silage and the rest are permanent pasture. They have 35 Fresian cows which are milked twice a day. They produce, on average, 500 litres of milk a day which is taken by bulk tanker to Stroud Creamery. They also have 160 sheep and 70 cattle which they fatten for sale at Gloucester market. They produce about 1000 bales of straw, 2000 bales of hay a year and sufficient silage for winter feed for the cows. They like their cows best and each one has a name - the favourites are Dolly and Minny.
